items.title: Trump Calls on Republicans to End Filibuster in Shutdown Fight
items.summary: The president said it was time for G.O.P. leaders to get rid of the longstanding rule requiring most Senate legislation to have 60 votes to pass.

items.title: Air Traffic Controller Staff Shortage Causes Delays in Orlando and at Other Airports
items.summary: The F.A.A. warned that a lack of certified air traffic controllers in Orlando could cause delays throughout the East Coast.

items.title: Enslaved Potter’s Art, Displayed at Boston Museum, Returns to Heirs at Last
items.summary: The Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, said David Drake, the artist, had been “deprived of his creations involuntarily and without compensation.”

items.title: Ohio Republicans Gain Ground in Push for More Seats in Congress
items.summary: The map, which is expected to be approved on Friday morning by the state’s redistricting commission, improves Republicans’ odds of picking up two more seats.

items.title: Trump Returns to White House in Time to Greet Trick-or-Treaters
items.summary: President Trump, who did not wear a costume, and the first lady handed out candy at the annual Halloween celebration at the White House.

items.title: A Top Trump Official Had to Sell His Stock. He May Have Saved Millions.
items.summary: Frank Bisignano, who holds top jobs at the Social Security Administration and the I.R.S., sold his stake in Fiserv before the company’s stock cratered this week.

items.title: Two found dead in flooded basements as New York hit by rainstorm
items.summary: <p>Separate incidents see bodies pulled from basements in Brooklyn and Manhattan as heavy rain closes roads and causes delays </p><p>Two people died in flooded New York City basements Thursday during a rainstorm that shut down roadways and caused airport delays, authorities said.</p><p>A scuba team recovered the body of a 39-year-old man after firefighters received a call of a person trapped in the flooded basement of a townhouse in Brooklyn at about 4.30pm, police said. A video posted online showed firefighters carrying the victim away through calf-deep water on the street.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/30/new-york-floods">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: More than half of Americans disapprove of Trump demolishing East Wing – poll
items.summary: <p>Survey, in which one-third respondents voted for the president, found 56% disagree with move</p><p>More than half of Americans disapprove of Trump’s demolition of the White House’s East Wing and the construction of a new ballroom, <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/documents/1d305cca-df33-44a8-ba8d-c98790a67f99.pdf?itid=lk_inline_manual_2">according to a new poll</a> from the Washington Post, ABC News and Ipsos.</p><p>The survey was conducted between 24 and 28 October and indicates 56% of the respondents disagree with Trump’s recent move while 28% are in favor of it. Most of the survey’s respondents were white, one-third of them voted for Donald Trump and another third for Kamala Harris in the 2024 election.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/30/americans-disapprove-trump-east-wing-poll">Continue reading...</a>
